jam.io.hdf
Class HDFile

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.io.RandomAccessFile
        |
        +--jam.io.hdf.HDFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.DataInput, java.io.DataOutput, HDFconstants
public class HDFile
extends java.io.RandomAccessFile
implements HDFconstants

Class which represents the HDF file on disk.

Since:
JDK1.1
Version:
0.5 November 98
Author:
Dale Visser

writeHeader

public void writeHeader()
                 throws HDFException
Writes the unique 4-byte pattern at the head of the file denoting that it is an HDF file.
Throws:
HDFException - error with writting hdf file

setOffsets

public void setOffsets()
Looks at the internal index of data elements and sets the offset fields of the DataObject's. To be run when all data elements have been defined.

writeDataObject

public void writeDataObject(DataObject data)
                     throws HDFException
Given a data object, writes out the appropriate bytes to the file on disk.
Parameters:
data - HDF data element
Throws:
HDFException - thrown if unrecoverable error occurs

addNumberTypes

public void addNumberTypes()
                    throws HDFException
Almost all of Jam's number storage needs are satisfied by the type hard-coded into the class NumberType. This method creates the NumberType object in the file that gets referred to repeatedly by the other data elements.
Throws:
HDFException - thrown if there is an error creating the number types
See Also:
NumberType

addMachineType

public void addMachineType()
Add element which tells other hdf software the encoding used in Vdatas, etc.
See Also:
JavaMachineType

getDoubleType

public NumberType getDoubleType()
Easy access to the double number type.

getIntType

public NumberType getIntType()
Easy access to the int number type.

addDataObject

public void addDataObject(DataObject data,
                          boolean useFileDefault)

Adds the data object to the file. The reference number is implicitly assigned at this time as the index number in the internal Vector DataObjects. A typical call should look like:

hdf = new hdfFile(outfile, "rw");
hdf.addDataObject(new DataObject(this));

Each call causes setOffsets to be called.

Parameters:
data - data object
boolean - useFileDefault if true, automatically assigns ref number, else lets object decide
See Also:
getUniqueRef(DataObject), setOffsets()

getUniqueRef

public short getUniqueRef(DataObject data)
The HDF standard only requires that for a particular tag type, each instance have a unique ref. Since our files are not expected to contain more than several dozen objects, I take the simplest approach of simply assigning the index number + 1 from the DataObjects Vector.

getSDD

public ScientificDataDimension getSDD(Histogram h)
Returns the existing valid SDD type for the histogram, creating a new one if necessary.

getSDD

public ScientificDataDimension getSDD(Histogram h,
                                      byte numtype)
Returns the existing valid SDD type for the histogram, creating a new one if necessary. DOUBLE type is explicitly requested, for error bars.
